newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends higher in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends higher in slow trade.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed higher against its U.S. counterpart in slow trade on Saturday, partly reflecting the weakness of the U.S. dollar overseas, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.501 against Friday's T$27.525 close. Turnover through dealers was a thin US$73 million.
Dealers said they saw no clear trend for the Taiwan dollar at the moment.
"Liquidity was so slow today that it's hard to see a trend," said one dealer. For next week, a stable T$27.49-27.54 range was seen. -- James Peng (5080815)
